intro: [WRONG START] Obernna behen subsp. thorei, commonly known as the Thorei barbed wire vine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, twining stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when immature and turn red when ripe. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in some regions.
